intro: Cacalia pentacantha, commonly known as the five-armed cacalia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a compact cluster, and it produces small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Cacalia pentacantha is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
